Design Director with over 9 years of experience designing and building digital products. Strong bias towards prototyping and customer research with a soft spot for typography. Focusing on:

Leadership

My name is Alex Cagwin. I'm a digital designer, the head of product design at Credo Health and a founding partner of Melostat. I have a passion for working in healthcare and helping companies find their 0 to 1.

Credo Health is a tech-enalbled healthcare company enabling the discovery, retreival and analysis of medical records. We're focused on making it that much easier to transfer your records so that your providers can spend more time on your health outcomes, not fax machines. I'm esctatic to help make an impact in the space.

Melostat is a product development acceleration agency. We help your team develop the practices and habits used at the best product companies by building software together. We have about 20 employees across the US focusing on lean product. Melostat has been fortunate enough to partner and build digital products for Dell Technologies, Nissan North America, Harley-Davidson, Astellas Pharmacueticals and Metromile.

My favorite Melostat project I've worked on has been Harley-Davidson. We were able to interview over 50 riders and dive into the excitement of riding a motorcycle. I even got my license for the project so that I could go on various local rides. Some of the interaction design we did was some of the most satisfying work I've done.

Previously, I had the opportunity to work at Parachute Health on a number of internal projects. One project that always stands out to me was optimizing their internal platform to enable new product verticals. Almost all of the work pixel-agonostic and I helped design functions and code for our internal teams.

I also did a stint with the team at SapientRazorfish working on the Publicis Groupe's internal platform, Marcel. I was there for 3 years, so ended up doing quite a bit of stuff. Paired with the Fluent Design Team at Microsoft on design the operating framework and experience architecture. Defined the vision and standards for a 10 person design team. Designed logic for a suggestion engine. And on of my favorite bits of work: Streamlined the timesheets submission process.

Before my more recent endeavors, I started my career at West Agile Labs as a QA analyst trying to break products. I was there for 3 years, where I built out and oversaw the design and product teams. I led our design team of five, pitched clients, managed resources, developed the West Agile brand and worked on over 45+ products, such as Natera, SpikeBee, Nvolv, Eventyoda, Octane AI, and ShearShare, which won Tech.Co’s startup of the year.

In my free time, I race downhill mountain bikes throughout the northeast corridor, take still images of sunsets when the colors are right, keep a running tab of burgers in new York City and occasionally attempt to make breakfast tacos.

  • Harley-Davidson

    Partnered with the teams at Gigster and Pivotal Labs to redefine Harley-Davidson’s ride planner tool on iOS, Android, and web throughout 2017. I led design in the second half of the project. I focused on refactoring the core experience, creating a new ride overview and allowing riders to customize their routes with ease.

  • Octane AI

  • ShearShare

    I’ve been working with 2016 Tech.Co's start up of the year, ShearShare, on and off since 2016 to help enable salon & barbershop owners fill space. I was able to help evolve their core interface brand, enable hosts to manage their listings, and refactored the core booking flow to make it more seamless to book.

At first glance, you’re probably saying, “damn, this guy is a lawyer” but really, it’s the lawyers that I know saying I should probably put some caveats into my document about whow I was the person to design everything here and I used principle for mac on everything related to motion. Anyways. as one of my buddies would say...
